section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section provides hands-on practice with Python variables, data types, and type conversion. Students will learn through interactive coding exercises to reinforce core programming concepts.
learning_objectives: Students will be able to declare and assign variables using valid Python syntax
Students will be able to identify and utilize Python's built-in data types effectively
Students will be able to perform explicit and implicit type conversions
Students will be able to debug common variable-related syntax and type errors

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create variables with appropriate names and assign values using different assignment techniques

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables (age, price, count) and assign them values. Print each variable with a descriptive message.
Declare variables for first_name, last_name, and full_name. Combine first and last name into full_name and print the result.

lessons.lesson_title: Working with Integer and Float Types
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform arithmetic operations and understand type behavior with integers and floating-point numbers
key_topics: Using the math module with numeric types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that calculates the area of a rectangle and a circle using integer and float values respectively. Display both results with type annotations.
Create a script that converts Celsius to Fahrenheit using floating-point arithmetic and displays the result with 2 decimal places.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to manipulate strings and convert between string and numeric types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Prompt the user for their age as a string, convert it to integer, then calculate their birth year. Handle any conversion errors gracefully.
Create a function that takes product price (float) and name (string) parameters, formats them into a label string, and returns the result.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create and evaluate Boolean expressions using comparison operators
key_topics: Truth values of different data types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write code that checks if a user's age is between 18-65 and if their account is active. Display appropriate access messages based on these conditions.
Create a script that tests the truth value of empty strings, zero values, and None in Boolean contexts.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to identify and resolve common variable type-related bugs in Python code
key_topics: Using the type() function for debugging

exercises.exercise_instructions: Debug a provided script containing 3 variable type errors. Fix each error and verify the outputs match expected results.
Modify an existing code snippet to include type checks and conversion before performing mathematical operations.
